data.title: The Lawns Holiday Home
data.text:
The house is not just an ordinary self catering holiday cottage or a barn conversion – it is a large Victorian house built with style and opulence.

The house has a modern central heating system, and a new boiler mighty enough to power a medium-size aircraft carrier, so you can make the house as warm as you like it.

In August 2017 we installed an £10,000 hot tub – HotSpring Relay on a deck outside. The hot tub can be used all year round, and has variable massage jets, waterfall, led lights, and is a real treat.

Spacious entrance hall (20 sq m, or 218 sq ft) with original encaustic floor tiles and imposing staircase with carved banister to the first floor bedrooms. Series of original 18th century botanical prints. Hall area is lit by antique bronze chandelier originally made in Holland. See Picture Gallery

Spacious sitting room (35 sq m, or 373 sq ft) with marble working fireplace (pictured above). Coffee table and large side table and a wonderful huge and welcoming leather sofa, as well as two large sofa beds. 2021 new Samsung ArtMode 50″ TV with Freesat. Stripped pine floor. Bay window to south-facing garden, with a view over our park. There are wicker armchairs in the bay window with a coffee table. Antique French marble and bronze mantle clock. Two Full King size sofa beds with bed linen available on request.

Spacious Dining room (35 sq m, or 373 sq ft) with a working Italian marble fireplace with hearth of African granite, large Victorian mahogany dining table capable of seating 18. Full King size sofa bed with bed linen available on request. Bay window to south-facing garden. Large James Dodd lino cut of Cromer. See Picture Gallery

Spacious kitchen (17 sq m, or 187 sq ft) with double-oven gas range cooker “Stoves”, fridge freezer “Samsung”, dishwasher “Bosch” and microwave “Samsung”, as well as double toaster. Large range of storage units containing sufficient china, glass and cutlery etc with a range of quality cooking utensils. Extending kitchen dining table and stools.

Off the kitchen is a small utility area with washing machine and a ground floor 2019 renovated shower/toilet.

Upstairs on the first floor there are FOUR double bedrooms and 2 bathrooms (and another newly renovated bathroom downstairs), one of which is very large (14 sq m, or 151 sq ft). The other bathroom is 7 sq m, or 76 sq ft.

1. “Tudor-style” four-poster bedroom (23 sq m, or 250 sq ft) with timber panelling, carved mahogany four-poster bed (made to order by And So To Bed company), antique furniture and rugs. Mahogany wardrobe, and marble fireplace (non-working). Zoffany wallpaper and antique framed prints.

2. Contemporary style bedroom (25 sq m, or 270 sq ft), with leather bed, leather seating, and wool pile rugs. Wood panelling, hardwood oak modern furniture. Original artwork by a Scottish artist from Cape Wrath. En suite – shower, bath and toilet from The Bath Store.

3. Smaller back double bedroom (7 sq m, or 80 sq ft), overlooking former stables and coach house. Modern furniture. Pillowtop Silk mattress by Hypnos.

4. “Eclectic mix-style” bedroom, (18 sq m, or 194 sq ft). Antique carpet, large antique gold guild frame, work of modern artist, antique and modern furniture.

We do have available a travel cot and a high chair for babies/small children.

There are also FOUR guest beds of high quality, (three Jay-Be J-bed, which are available as standard, as well as a single air bed, and can be put into any room).

There is high-speed wireless broadband coverage throughout the house. Last upgraded in January 2021 to Fast Fibre broadband.

The Garden is walled/enclosed. We advise supervision at all times, though. The garden is in two sections – huge formal lawn, which is private to The Lawns Holiday Home, and the informal lawn, with playground, large trampoline, chicken enclosure, meadow etc. This area is less formal, and is shared with the owners and the Lawns Apartment guests.
